com.intland.codebeamer.utils

Class AnchoredDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intland.codebeamer.utils.AnchoredDate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AnchoredDate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An anchored date is a date relative to a an anchor date and is defined as an AnchoredPeriod.Edge of an AnchoredPeriod relative to the anchor date.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnchoredDate.Decoder
      A special StringDecoder for AnchoredDate definitions, see decode(String)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnchoredDate

        public AnchoredDate(AnchoredPeriod.Edge edge,
            AnchoredPeriod period)
        Create an anchored date representing the specified edge of the specified period
        Parameters:
        edge - of the period to be represented
        period - is the underlying period to determine the offset of the edge from the anchor date

    • Method Detail

      • getEdge

        public AnchoredPeriod.Edge getEdge()
        Get the edge of the getPeriod() represented by this AnchoredDate
        Returns:
        the represented period AnchoredPeriod.Edge

      • getPeriod

        public AnchoredPeriod getPeriod()
        Get the underlying period of this AnchoredDate
        Returns:
        the underlying AnchoredPeriod

      • getDate

        public java.util.Date getDate(java.util.Date at,
                     java.util.TimeZone timezone)
        Get the absolute date of this anchored date relative to the specified date in the specified timezone
        Parameters:
        at - is the anchor date for the period, or null to use current system time
        timezone - is the timezone to calculate local edge date, or null to use default/system time zone
        Returns:
        this edge of the specified period relative to the specified date in the specified timezone

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • decode

        public static AnchoredDate decode(java.lang.String definition)
        Decode a string of the form: "[At] [the] {Begin|Start|End} [of] [the] period"
        where period can be any valid AnchoredPeriod definition (see AnchoredPeriod.decode(String)), e.g.
        • "Begin of the current day",
        • "End of the next 2 weeks",
        • "At the begin of the past 2 quarters"

        Parameters:
        definition - to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded DateChoice, or null if definition was empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if definition is invalid
